cultural_etiquette: Cover shoulders and knees when entering any Thai temple; carry a sarong.
Never point your feet at people or Buddha statues as it is considered disrespectful.
important_tips: Download the 'Grab' app for fair-priced taxi rides.
Buy a local SIM card (AIS or DTAC) at the airport for ₹600.

accommodation.booking_tip: Request a river-facing room on a higher floor for the best city skyline views.
accommodation.name: Ibis Bangkok Riverside
accommodation.why_this: Offers great river views and a free shuttle to the BTS Skytrain station.

activities.description: A trendy night market famous for its white tents, vintage cars, and incredible variety of street food including spicy pork ribs and fresh seafood.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Jodd Fairs, Rama IX Rd, Huai Khwang, Bangkok, Thailand
activities.how_to_reach: MRT Blue Line to Phra Ram 9 Station — ₹120, 25 min
activities.local_secret: Look for the 'Leng Saab' (spicy pork mountain) stall; it's the market's most famous and photogenic dish.
activities.tips: Go early (6:30 PM) to secure a table as it gets very crowded by 8 PM.
activities.why_this_fits: Perfect introduction to Thai food culture with hundreds of affordable local delicacies in one spot.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Relax by the Chao Phraya River and watch the long-tail boats pass by.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Humid evening (28°C); wear breathable cotton fabrics.
itinerary.evening_summary: Explore the vibrant stalls and neon lights of Jodd Fairs Night Market.
itinerary.morning_summary: Arrive at Suvarnabhumi Airport and transfer to your riverside hotel.
itinerary.notes: Airport taxi to hotel costs roughly ₹800 including tolls.

accommodation.booking_tip: Use the hotel's pool in the afternoon to beat the Bangkok heat.
accommodation.name: Ibis Bangkok Riverside
accommodation.why_this: Central riverside location makes temple hopping by boat very easy.

activities.description: A complex of stunning buildings that served as the official residence of the Kings of Siam since 1782, featuring intricate gold leaf and glass mosaics.
activities.google_maps_search_query: The Grand Palace, Na Phra Lan Rd, Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang, Bangkok, Thailand
activities.how_to_reach: Chao Phraya Express Boat to Tha Chang Pier — ₹40, 20 min
activities.local_secret: Your ticket includes entry to the Khon Thai Classical Masked Dance at Sala Chalermkrung Royal Theatre.
activities.tips: Strict dress code: no leggings, ripped jeans, or sleeveless tops.
activities.why_this_fits: The ultimate temple experience for anyone interested in Thai history and royal architecture.

activities.description: An iconic riverside temple known for its towering prang decorated with porcelain fragments that shimmer in the sunlight.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Wat Arun Ratchawararam Ratchawaramahawihan, Bangkok, Thailand
activities.how_to_reach: Cross-river ferry from Wat Pho pier — ₹12, 5 min
activities.local_secret: Climb the steep central stairs for a panoramic view of the Chao Phraya River.
activities.tips: Visit during the 'golden hour' just before sunset for the best photography.
activities.why_this_fits: One of the most beautiful temples in Thailand, offering a unique architectural style compared to the Grand Palace.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Marvel at the Reclining Buddha at Wat Pho and cross the river to Wat Arun.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Very hot at the Palace; carry an umbrella for shade.
itinerary.evening_summary: Dinner at a local eatery followed by a walk through Khao San Road.
itinerary.morning_summary: Visit the majestic Grand Palace and the Emerald Buddha.
itinerary.notes: Lunch at a local 'Soi' near Wat Pho costs around ₹400.

accommodation.booking_tip: Check out early tomorrow for your flight to Krabi.
accommodation.name: Ibis Bangkok Riverside
accommodation.why_this: Reliable standard hotel with easy access to the city's food hubs.

activities.description: Ranked as one of the world's best fresh markets, offering premium fruits, ready-to-eat Thai snacks, and high-quality ingredients.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Or Tor Kor Market, Kamphaeng Phet Rd, Chatuchak, Bangkok, Thailand
activities.how_to_reach: MRT Blue Line to Kamphaeng Phet Station — ₹100, 30 min
activities.local_secret: Try the 'Khanom Krok' (coconut rice pancakes) from the stalls in the center of the market.
activities.tips: This market is more expensive than others but the quality is significantly higher.
activities.why_this_fits: A food lover's paradise where you can taste exotic fruits like Durian and Mangosteen in a clean environment.

activities.description: The most legendary Pad Thai spot in Bangkok, famous for its 'Superb Pad Thai' wrapped in a thin omelet.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Thip Samai, Maha Chai Rd, Samran Rat, Phra Nakhon, Bangkok, Thailand
activities.local_secret: Order their fresh orange juice with pulp; many locals claim it's even better than the noodles.
activities.tips: Expect a queue; arriving by 6:30 PM helps minimize the wait.
activities.why_this_fits: A must-visit for foodies wanting to try the gold standard of Thailand's national dish.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Visit the Jim Thompson House for a glimpse of traditional Thai silk and teak architecture.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Afternoon showers possible; keep a light raincoat handy.
itinerary.evening_summary: Savor the world-famous Pad Thai at Thip Samai.
itinerary.morning_summary: Explore the massive Or Tor Kor fresh market.
itinerary.notes: Budget includes a visit to Jim Thompson House (₹500 entry).

accommodation.booking_tip: Book an 'Adults Only' wing room for a quieter experience.
accommodation.name: Bluesotel Smart Krabi
accommodation.why_this: Modern hotel located just 200m from the beach and main dining strip.

activities.description: A peninsula accessible only by boat, surrounded by towering limestone cliffs and turquoise waters.
activities.how_to_reach: Long-tail boat from Ao Nang Beach — ₹250 (return), 15 min
activities.local_secret: Walk to Phra Nang Cave Beach at the southern end to see the unique 'Princess Cave' shrine.
activities.tips: The last boat back to Ao Nang is usually around 6:30 PM; don't miss it!
activities.why_this_fits: Fulfills the beach interest with some of the most dramatic coastal scenery in the world.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Take a long-tail boat to Railay Beach for a swim.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Coastal breeze; perfect for a sunset beach walk.
itinerary.evening_summary: Sunset cocktails and dinner at a beachfront restaurant.
itinerary.morning_summary: Fly from Bangkok to Krabi and transfer to Ao Nang.
itinerary.notes: Transport includes BKK-KBV flight (approx ₹3500) and airport transfer.

accommodation.booking_tip: Ask for a room with a balcony to dry your swimwear.
accommodation.name: Bluesotel Smart Krabi
accommodation.why_this: Great pool to relax in after a day out at sea.

activities.description: A classic Krabi tour visiting four distinct islands, featuring a sandbar walk at Tup Island and snorkeling at Chicken Island.
activities.how_to_reach: Hotel pickup included in tour price — 0 min
activities.local_secret: Ask your guide to stop at the 'hidden' snorkeling spot behind Chicken Island for fewer crowds.
activities.tips: Bring a waterproof bag for your phone and camera.
activities.why_this_fits: The quintessential Thai beach experience with multiple stops for swimming and photography.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Snorkeling in crystal clear waters and picnic lunch on the sand.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: High UV index; reapply sunscreen every 2 hours.
itinerary.evening_summary: Relaxing Thai massage and seafood dinner in Ao Nang.
itinerary.morning_summary: Speedboat tour to the 4 Islands: Koh Poda, Chicken Island, Tup Island, and Phra Nang.
itinerary.notes: Dinner at Ao Nang Seafood Street costs approx ₹1500 for two.

accommodation.booking_tip: Check out the rooftop bar for a final view of the limestone cliffs.
accommodation.name: Bluesotel Smart Krabi
accommodation.why_this: Conveniently located for the final night's shopping and dining.

activities.description: A sacred site known for the tiger paw prints in the cave and the challenging climb to a golden Buddha with 360-degree views.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Wat Tham Suea, Krabi Noi, Krabi, Thailand
activities.local_secret: Watch out for the monkeys at the base; keep all food and shiny objects inside your bag.
activities.tips: Carry at least 1 liter of water for the climb.
activities.why_this_fits: Combines your interest in temples with an incredible physical challenge and rewarding views.

activities.description: A local market offering grilled meats, fresh fruit shakes, and affordable souvenirs.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Ao Nang Night Market, Krabi, Thailand
activities.local_secret: Try the 'Banana Nutella Pancake' (Roti) — it's a Southern Thai specialty.
activities.tips: Great place to buy last-minute elephant pants or magnets.
activities.why_this_fits: A great way to end the trip with authentic, low-cost Thai food.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Visit the Krabi Town riverfront and the 'Crab' statues.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: 1,237 steps to climb; start early to avoid the midday sun.
itinerary.evening_summary: Farewell dinner at the Ao Nang Night Market.
itinerary.morning_summary: Climb to the summit of Wat Tham Suea (Tiger Cave Temple).
itinerary.notes: Lunch in Krabi Town is very cheap (approx ₹300).

activities.description: A final stroll along the main beach of Ao Nang to soak in the views of the limestone karsts.
activities.local_secret: The far left end of the beach (near the cliffs) is the quietest spot for a morning dip.
activities.tips: Shower at the hotel before checking out at noon.
activities.why_this_fits: A peaceful way to say goodbye to the Thai coast.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Transfer to Krabi Airport for flight to Bangkok and then Mumbai.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Keep a light jacket for the air-conditioned airports.
itinerary.evening_summary: Board your international flight back home.
itinerary.morning_summary: Enjoy a final Thai breakfast and some beach time.
itinerary.notes: Budget includes airport transfer and snacks for the journey.

money_saving_hacks: Drink water from hotel dispensers or buy large bottles at 7-Eleven.
Eat at 'Food Courts' in malls like Terminal 21 for clean, cheap meals (₹150).
overall_vibe: You will wake up to the serene chanting of monks in Bangkok before transitioning to the rhythmic lapping of Andaman waves. This journey balances spiritual exploration with tropical relaxation and world-class street food.
packing_tips: Reef-safe sunscreen to protect the coral reefs.
Universal travel adapter (Thailand uses Type A, B, and C).
Dry bag for island hopping tours.
smart_insights: Use the Rabbit Card for Bangkok BTS Skytrain to save time and small change.
Book the Krabi 4-Island tour locally at Ao Nang beach for better bargaining than online.

travel_between_cities.booking: Book on AirAsia.com 4 weeks in advance.
travel_between_cities.tips: Check if your flight departs from Suvarnabhumi (BKK) or Don Mueang (DMK).

trip_title: Thai Treasures: Temples of Bangkok & Krabi's Azure Shores
validation_warnings: Some activities may have generic names (e.g.: Jodd Fairs Night Market, The Grand Palace, Or Tor Kor Market). For more specific recommendations, try providing more detailed preferences.
Note: Individual day costs sum to ₹41,800, which differs from the stated total of ₹80,000. Transport between cities may account for this difference.
